justification: "Then, using Likert scales, evaluators judged the following questions: problem solving skills, decision making, strategic making. Response options were translated into a 1 to 5 scale."
The article states that evaluators "using Likert scales" judged "strategic making," with responses placed on a 1–5 scale, indicating this construct was assessed through those Likert ratings.
Evaluators "judged the following questions: problem solving skills, decision making, strategic making" on a 1–5 Likert scale, showing decision-making was measured via that scale.

In Study 2 the authors note "we also measure self efficacy (Bandura, A., Barbaranelli, C., Caprara, G. V., & Pastorelli, C. 2001)," referencing Bandura’s established self-efficacy instrument as their measure.
